page.title: 09WETHERBY MARKET
page.content: Wetherby market came into existence in 1240. It is not very large only having about 23 stalls, although there is a wide variety of goods on sale: fruit and veg., handbags, fish and meat, dairy produce, household goods, sweets, flowers, hosiery and bakery. The present traders have been coming for about 10 years, but one has been coming for about 40 years. Some leave home soon after 4.00am in order to get here between 6.30 to 7.00 am to set up. One trader had come 44 miles the others were more local. We found that they also go to other markets such as Leeds, Knaresborough, Otley and Skipton. The fruit and vegetable man said he served about a 1000 a day but one only served about 40 a day. Most of the traders like their job and always come unless the weather is very bad.
